content: oh-so-frugal shopping bag designed by sue mcleod september 2012 after knitting up some market bags and being frustrated with certain features and getting feedback from the supermarket clerks who had to fill them with my groceries i finally decided that i had to design my own using those plastic bags we get at supermarkets in the us as my guide i ve created a bag that s 1 easy to knit out of any yarn 2 easy to fill with groceries dimensions 3 strong enough and stretchy enough to hold a lot 4 won t stretch and drag on the ground while you re circumference 24 inches carrying them while full length without handles not stretched 12 inches the clerks at my market love these length of handles 14 inches yarns dk or sport sample made with halcyon s pearl cotton 3/2 light blue 1 5 ounces 120 yards used of a 180 yd mini cone knitting pattern created by sue mcleod this pattern write-up and all photos are copyrighted please do not use without attribution or republish in any way without permission you are free to use your knitting of this pattern in any way you d like instructions sport or dk weight yarn round 3 decrease round *k7 k2tog* repeat to end of round notions round 4 k size 8 us 16 circular and set of 4 or 5 continue repeating these two rounds double pointed needles working one less knit stitch on the tapestry needle decrease rounds each repeat until only 9 stitches remain when necessary switch instructions from the circular needle to double points to cast on 90 stitches and join for working in finish the bottom the round cut yarn leaving an 6 tail tread tail onto round 1 knit tapestry needles and through the round 2 purl remaining stitches on the needle bring tail to the back and weave in round 3 knit handles round 4 purl measure 2 inches from side of bag pick up round 5 knit 3 stitches along edge using one of the double pointed needles work 3 stitch i- start lace pattern cord for 14 inches round 6 k wrapping yarn twice around measure 2 inches from opposite side of bag the needle and pulling both strands see photo bring i-cord to the front and through continue this way to end of round graft i-cord stitches to top edge stitches round 7 k into one loop only allowing the repeat on other side of the bag other look to drop finishing round 8 k weave in ends securely especially for the repeat rounds 6-8 until bag length handles i like to use a few knots just in measures 9 without stretching case start bottom decreases round 1 decrease round *k8 k2tog* repeat to end of round round 2 k
